Article.ArticleTitle: Ge N-Channel MOSFETs with ZrO<sub>2</sub> Dielectric Achieving Improved Mobility.

AbstractText: High-mobility Ge nMOSFETs with ZrO<sub>2</sub> gate dielectric are demonstrated and compared against transistors with different interfacial properties of ozone (O<sub>3</sub>) treatment, O<sub>3</sub> post-treatment and without O<sub>3</sub> treatment. It is found that with O<sub>3</sub> treatment, the Ge nMOSFETs with ZrO<sub>2</sub> dielectric having a EOT of 0.83 nm obtain a peak effective electron mobility (μ<sub>eff</sub>) of 682 cm<sup>2</sup>/Vs, which is higher than that of the Si universal mobility at the medium inversion charge density (Q<sub>inv</sub>). On the other hand, the O<sub>3</sub> post-treatment with Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub> interfacial layer can provide dramatically enhanced-μ<sub>eff</sub>, achieving about 50% μ<sub>eff</sub> improvement as compared to the Si universal mobility at medium Q<sub>inv</sub> of 5 × 10<sup>12</sup> cm<sup>-2</sup>. These results indicate the potential utilization of ZrO<sub>2</sub> dielectric in high-performance Ge nMOSFETs.
